translation: It instructs Mañjuśrī to admonish the good wealthy not to become disillusioned with seeing good teachers and not to see faults.
After the fifth good man, it goes down to the part where the monk Dewun will help you.
down to that, the monk Dewun will explain it for you.
There are four and a half lines of the sūtra.
It has about five teachings.
One shows the aspect of the good teacher's abode.
Two, it shows the land in which the good man lives.
Three shows the place where the good teacher lives.
Four gives the good teacher a name based on his virtues.

source_sentence: 五舉善知識道德堪能演說何法如文具說。
translation: Five, it shows the good teacher's morality and ability to explain what teaching is as described on the page.

source_sentence: 新華嚴經論卷第三十三
translation: Treatise on the New Translation of the Flower Ornament Sutra, Vol. 33
